issue.title: [fund.ts.v2] to_array should take rvalue reference as well

discussion.p: C++ doesn't have a prvalue expression of array type, but rvalue arrays can still come from different kinds of sources:

blockquote.p: See also CWG 1591: Deducing array bound and element type from initializer list.

discussion.p:
For 3), users are "abusing" to_array to get access to uniform initialization to benefit from initializing elements through braced-init-list and/or better narrowing conversion support.
We should just add rvalue reference support to to_array.
Would like a small paper; see examples before and after. How does this affect overload resolution?

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4600.

blockquote.p: -6- Returns: For all i, 0 ≤ i < N, aAn array<remove_cv_t<T>, N> such that each element is copy-initialized with the corresponding element of ainitialized with { a[i]... } for the first form, or { std::move(a[i])... } for the second form..
